TEXT: CARDINAL . PERSON , a shopkeeper , lives in GPE di GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE a lawyer , Mr PERSON , sold her a plot of land adjoining his property in GPE . Numerous disputes arose between them .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON laid a complaint against the applicant with the GPE di GPE public prosecutor . On DATE the local carabinieri questioned PERSON in connection with the acts of which she was accused .
On DATE notice of criminal proceedings was served on the applicant and on DATE she was interviewed by the public prosecutor . In the meantime she had accused Mr PERSON of attempted blackmail .

CARDINAL . Further incidents led Mr PERSON to file additional complaints on DATE , DATE , DATE . Pursuant to a warrant issued by the investigating judge on DATE , PERSON was arrested on DATE and questioned on DATE .

CARDINAL . She was released on DATE , but by a decision ( decreto di citazione ) of DATE was summoned to appear in the GPE di ORG charged , inter alia , with threatening to cause bodily harm to Mr PERSON and his son ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ) , issuing threats intended to coerce witnesses into giving false evidence ( LAW ) , harassment by telephone ( LAW ) , attacking the complainant ’s honour and reputation by insults and defamation ( Articles CARDINAL ) and criminal damage ( Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . When the trial opened on DATE , the public prosecutor called for a charge of repeated false accusation ( calunnia continuata - Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) to be added to the indictment , whereupon ORG adjourned the proceedings .

CARDINAL . Trying PERSON on a new indictment , ORG sentenced her on DATE to a suspended term of DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , not to be entered on her criminal record . It also fined her MONEY and awarded damages against her .

CARDINAL . On an appeal by the applicant , the Reggio di Calabria Court of Appeal , giving judgment on DATE , quashed the conviction on CARDINAL count and reduced the suspended prison sentence by DATE .

CARDINAL . PERSON and the public prosecutor appealed to ORG . The applicant filed her submissions in a memorial of DATE . On DATE the registrar informed the lawyer appointed by her ( difensore di fiducia ) that the file had reached ORG . On DATE the lawyer received the notice fixing the date of the hearing . On DATE he asked the court to postpone the hearing set down for DATE , as his state of health prevented him from attending on that date . He had had an operation and when he had left hospital on DATE his doctor had prescribed CARDINAL days’ total rest for him . The letter reached the registry on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . The hearing before ORG was nevertheless held on DATE . On that date the public prosecutor opposed an adjournment . ORG refused to accede to the applicant ’s lawyer ’s request and proceeded to hear the case in the latter ’s absence . In a judgment of DATE , filed with the registry on DATE , it dismissed the appeals of both parties .

CARDINAL . The main provisions of LAW in force at the material time with regard to the procedure in ORG and various Articles concerning the replacement of counsel and the adjournment of hearings are set out below .
CARDINAL .
" Where the submissions [ in support of the appeal ] have been filed in good time , further submissions may be lodged within the time - limit laid down in LAW . "

" As soon as the file reaches the registry , the registrar of ORG shall advise the defendant ’s lawyer that , for DATE following service of the notice , he may consult the file at the registry , make copies of the documents therein and produce new documents . "

The parties to the proceedings other than the prosecution may appear only through their lawyers , who must be entered on the special roll of ORG ; they may file with the registry , not DATE before DATE fixed for the hearing , memorials ... setting out legal argument in support of their submissions .

At the hearing the President or the member of ORG delegated by him shall read out the report . The parties’ lawyers are not required to be present or to make final submissions . A lawyer other than the CARDINAL designated in the notice of appeal may address the ORG ... provided that he has received special authority to this effect . "
CARDINAL .
The accused may not be assisted by CARDINAL lawyers . "

" If they are unable to attend on legitimate grounds , the lawyer or lawyers appointed by the parties may each designate a lawyer to replace them ; the latter shall be authorised to take part in the hearing only for as long as it remains necessary for them to replace the lawyer or lawyers in question .
CARDINAL .
" Where it is expressly authorised by the law , or if it becomes absolutely necessary to do so , ORG , ORG or ORG ( " pretore " ) may make an order adjourning the hearing . "

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the new Code of Criminal Procedure , which entered into force on DATE , now provides that " where the lawyer is absent because there are legitimate reasons making it absolutely impossible for him to appear , the judge shall stay or adjourn the hearing " .
